title: New Hope (Israel)
text:
New Hope (), officially known as New Hope — Unity for Israel (), is a <a href="Centre-right%20politics">center-right</a> to <a href="Right-wing%20politics">right-wing</a> <a href="Conservatism">conservative</a> and <a href="National%20liberalism">national-liberal</a> political party in <a href="Israel">Israel</a>.
History.
The party was formed by former <a href="Likud">Likud</a> MK and former minister <a href="Gideon%20Sa%27ar">Gideon Sa'ar</a> on 8 December 2020, with Sa'ar subsequently submitting his resignation from the <a href="Knesset">Knesset</a> on 9 December. On the same day, <a href="Derekh%20Eretz%20%28political%20faction%29">Derekh Eretz</a> MKs <a href="Yoaz%20Hendel">Yoaz Hendel</a> and <a href="Zvi%20Hauser">Zvi Hauser</a> announced that they would join New Hope. <a href="Likud">Likud</a> MKs <a href="Yifat%20Shasha-Biton">Yifat Shasha-Biton</a>, <a href="Michal%20Shir">Michal Shir</a>, <a href="Sharren%20Haskel">Sharren Haskel</a>, and <a href="Ze%27ev%20Elkin">Ze'ev Elkin</a> later joined as well. <a href="Meir%20Yitzhak%20Halevi">Meir Yitzhak Halevi</a> joined the party on 28 December. <a href="Benny%20Begin">Benny Begin</a> and <a href="Dani%20Dayan">Dani Dayan</a> joined on 21 January 2021, whilst MK <a href="Hila%20Vazan">Hila Vazan</a> joined on 31 January.
The party signed a surplus-vote agreement with <a href="Yamina">Yamina</a> on 4 January 2021.
Policy.
New Hope sees the State of Israel as the nation state of the <a href="Jewish%20People">Jewish people</a> and sees importance in military, economic, technological, research, settlement aspects of the state, with support for <a href="Aliyah">immigration to Israel</a>. The party sees social divisions in Israel as problematic and promises to work for reconciliation and connection between parts of the nation.
Financial policy.
The party supports a partially <a href="mixed%20economy">mixed economy</a> with a strong (partially subsidized) capitalist focus. It advocates an expansion of the technological sector and of Israel's infrastructure, as well as supporting a reduction in the size of the country's bureaucracy. On the other hand, it supports an expansion of Israel's <a href="social%20safety%20net">social safety net</a>, as well as grants for small businesses.
Government reform.
New Hope supports <a href="term%20limit">term limit</a>s, with a proposal to limit the tenure of a prime minister to eight years. In addition, their platform includes a proposal to elect the <a href="Knesset">Knesset</a> via <a href="Mixed-member%20proportional%20representation">mixed-member representation</a>.
The party is also interested in increasing the powers of local government at the expense of the powers of the central government.
